result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan T Langdon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Joint and Several with co-defendant.  It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users unless through a therapy setting.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family) unless approved by them and agent.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Court Reporter:  Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Ryan T Langdon in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Ryan T Langdon in custody.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Per State, they are Chapter 950 compliant, no additions or corrections to PSI.
Defense had no additions or corrections to PSI.  Stipulation as to restitution.

State recommends imposed & stayed prison with 2-3 years probation with 120 days jail conditional time.
Defense concurs with that recommendation.

BTC:  count 1:  WSP 2 years (1 year IC & 1 year ES)
no alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's & Breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment & aftercare and any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent
full time employment
Restitution $2559.95 joint and several with mother, Jilleen Langdon
no contact, direct or indirectly, with victims unless approved by them and agent
no association with anyone with drug conviction unless in therapy setting.

count 2:  WSP 2 years (1 year IC & 1 year ES)
same conditions
consecutive to count 1
CIP and SAT eligible
DNA sample if not already on file with DOC.
Firearms/voting warnings
Costs including DNA on both counts
CFTS - may bring back to court if disagrees with accounting
charater letter for def (no action taken sentencing has taken place)

Conditions:  Immediate cooperation with PSI is required.  No contact with the victims, J.L. and K.H. (person, property, residence or family).
